critique: This document pertains to the appointment of an administrator for the Puerto Rico Reconstruction Administration in 1947. Given the context of the Emergency Relief Appropriation Act of 1935 and subsequent acts, the document seems to focus on economic recovery and government intervention in Puerto Rico. There is no information related to immigration, civil liberties, or social issues. The document itself does not expand executive power, but rather executes existing legislation. It centralizes power in the federal government as it relates to Puerto Rico's reconstruction. The ideological tilt is moderately liberal, given the context of the New Deal era and focus on government intervention for economic recovery.
